results.title: There's always a better way. No. 2
results.brief_description: Illustrates how modern manufacturing methods, using highly mechanized equipment, have reduced the production cost for locomotive wheels. Shows the use of a special block-breaker increasing production from 24 to 315 ingot sections per shift; the mechanical handling and cleaning of heated ingots; the operation of a 1,000 ton press, moulding and forging a half ton ingot in the short period of two minutes.

results.title: There's always a better way. No. 1
results.brief_description: Illustrates five ways in which new manufacturing techniques have reduced production costs; the removal of covering material in electrical cables using a foot operated device; binding vacuum cleaner bags to plastic caps; turning tubes of cloth inside out; provision of work benches for maximum efficiency; the use of two planing machines in series simplifying handling of timber to be planed on both sides.

results.title: There's a way
results.brief_description: A dramatized account of how, with improvisation and a relatively small expense, a modest rehabilitation department can be set up in a hospital. Patients are brought back to normal life and work more quickly through group treatment, and existing hospital resources are used to better advantage with a quicker turnover of patients.

results.title: Theory of flight
results.brief_description: Wind tunnel tests demonstrate the relation between air velocity and lift and drag on plain and cambered air-foils; control of aeroplane movements about vertical, lateral, and longitudinal axes by means of rudder, elevator, and ailerons respectively, are demonstrated.
results.description: Wind tunnel tests demonstrate the relation between air velocity and lift and drag on plain and cambered air-foils; control of aeroplane movements about vertical, lateral, and longitudinal axes by means of rudder, elevator, and ailerons respectively, are demonstrated.

results.title: Theories on the origin of life
results.creator_credit: Bert Van Bork and Encyclopaedia Britannica Educational Corporation
results.brief_description: This presentation of four theories on the origin of life is designed to promote discussion and lead to research. The theory of “special creation” attributes the origin of life to a supernatural being; the theory of spontaneous generation proposes that life originated from inorganic materials; while the cosmozic theory suggests that life on earth originated elsewhere in the universe. The final theory introduced is the now commonly accepted theory of evolution. Equal emphasis is given to each theory to encourage students to discuss the evidence on which the theories are based.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Bert Van Bork and Encyclopaedia Britannica Educational Corporation

results.title: Them and us: a case study
results.creator_credit: Peter K. Smith, Terrick Fitzhugh, Film Producers Guild and Technical and Scientific Films
results.brief_description: A large industrial firm is used as a case study to illstrate the need for cooperation and understanding of each other’s needs between management and the representatives of employee groups. Illustrates employee representation in management.

results.title: Theirs is tomorrow
results.creator_credit: Roy A. Driver and Herschells Films
results.brief_description: A survey of the educational facilities provided by the Education Department in the State of Victoria. The film shows typical activities of students attending Primary, Secondary and Technical schools and at the Teachers Training College.

results.title: Their world (TEFC)
results.brief_description: This film explores the significance of play as a preparation for life and is an insight into child beahviour and personality. By confonting a selection of children with a “mini world” each child is invited to build his or her world using a vast assortment of tiny props. Hungarian dialogue with English subtitles.

results.title: Their health is our wealth
results.creator_credit: Malcolm Otton, Eric Thompson and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: The film shows the various stages of training for degrees in Veterinary Science at the University of Sydney and the University of Brisbane, including academic training and practical training at the University farm. The film also shows aspects of the various fields of work open to graduates (for example private practice with farm animals or pets, research work for government agencies or commercial firms).
